verses.translation: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
verses.transliteration: Wa inna laka la ajran ghaira mamnoon

verses.translation: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
So you will see and they will see
Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].

verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.arabicSimple: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.translation: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
verses.transliteration: Innaa Rabbaka Huwa a'lamu biman dalla 'an sabeelihee wa Huwa a'lamu bilmuhtadeen

verses.translation: Then do not obey the deniers.
They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
verses.transliteration: Wa laa tuti' kulla hallaa fim maheen

verses.translation: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.
Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,

verses.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.arabicSimple: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
verses.transliteration: Izaa tutlaa 'alaihi aayaatunaa qaala asaateerul awwaleen

verses.translation: We will brand him upon the snout.

verses.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
verses.arabicSimple: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
verses.translation: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
verses.transliteration: Innaa balawnaahum kamaa balawnaaa As-haabal jannati iz 'aqsamoo la-yasri munnahaa musbiheen

verses.translation: Without making exception.

verses.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
verses.translation: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
verses.transliteration: Fataafa 'alaihaa taaa'i fum mir rabbika wa hum naaa'imoon

verses.translation: And it became as though reaped.
And they called one another at morning,

verses.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
verses.arabicSimple: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
verses.translation: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
So they set out, while lowering their voices,

verses.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
verses.arabicSimple: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
verses.translation: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
verses.transliteration: Falammaa ra awhaa qaalooo innaa ladaaalloon

verses.translation: Rather, we have been deprived."

verses.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
verses.translation: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "
verses.transliteration: Qaala awsatuhum alam aqul lakum law laa tusabbihoon

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
verses.arabicSimple: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
verses.translation: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
verses.transliteration: Qaaloo subhaana rabbinaaa innaa kunnaa zaalimeen

verses.translation: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
verses.transliteration: Qaaloo yaa wailanaaa innaa kunnaa taagheen

verses.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
verses.translation: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."
verses.transliteration: 'Asaa rabbunaaa any yubdilanaa khairam minhaaa innaaa ilaa rabbinaa raaghiboon

verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
verses.transliteration: Kazaalikal azaab, wa la'azaabul aakhirati akbar; law kaanoo ya'lamoon

segments.translation: Such is the punishment And surely the punishment of the Hereafter is greater

verses.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.arabicSimple: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.translation: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
That indeed for you is whatever you choose?

verses.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
verses.translation: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
verses.transliteration: Am lakum aymaanun 'alainaa baalighatun ilaa yawmil qiyaamati inna lakum lamaa tahkumoon

segments.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ
segments.translation: Or for you oaths from us reaching to the Day of the Resurrection
segments.transliteration: am lakum aymānun ʿalaynā bālighatun ilā yawmi l-qiyāmati

segments.translation: indeed for you is what you judge

verses.translation: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.

verses.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
verses.arabicSimple: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
verses.transliteration: Am lahum shurakaaa'u falyaatoo bishurakaaa 'ihim in kaanoo saadiqeen

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.translation: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,
verses.transliteration: Yawma yukshafu 'am saaqinw wa yud'awna ilas sujoodi falaa yastatee'oon

verses.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
verses.translation: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
verses.transliteration: Khaashi'atan absaaruhum tarhaquhum zillatunw wa qad kaanoo yud'awna ilassujoodi wa hum saalimoon

segments.translation: Humbled their eyes will cover them humiliation

segments.arabic: وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
segments.translation: And indeed they were called to prostrate while they were sound
segments.transliteration: waqad kānū yud'ʿawna ilā l-sujūdi wahum sālimūna

verses.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
verses.transliteration: Fazarnee wa many yukazzibu bihaazal hadeesi sanastad rijuhum min haisu laa ya'lamoon

segments.translation: So leave Me and whoever denies this Statement
We will progressively lead them from where not they know

verses.translation: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
verses.transliteration: Wa umlee lahum; inna kaidee mateen

verses.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
verses.arabicSimple: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
verses.translation: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
verses.transliteration: Am tas'aluhum ajran fahum mim maghramim musqaloon

verses.translation: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

verses.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
verses.arabicSimple: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
verses.translation: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
verses.transliteration: Fasbir lihkmi rabbika wa laa takun kasaahibil boot; iz naadaa wa huwa makzoom

verses.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
verses.arabicSimple: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
verses.translation: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.
verses.transliteration: Law laaa an tadaara kahoo ni'matum mir rabbihee lanubiza bil'araaa'i wa huwa mazmoom

words.translation: surely he would have been thrown

verses.translation: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

verses.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.arabicSimple: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.translation: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
verses.transliteration: Wa iny-yakaadul lazeena kafaroo la-yuzliqoonaka biabsaarihim lammaa saml'uz-Zikra wa yaqooloona innahoo lamajnoon

verses.translation: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
verses.transliteration: Wa maa huwa illaa zikrul lil'aalameen
